newsitem.title: UK: Britain to call in Belarus envoy.
newsitem.headline: Britain to call in Belarus envoy.

text.p: The British Foreign Office said on Thursday it was calling in the Belarus ambassador to "express concern" at the political situation in the former Soviet republic.

Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko has drawn wide international criticism for his plans to hold a referendum this weekend on widening his powers and his refusal to compromise with his parliamentary opponents.
A Foreign Office spokesman said: "We are calling in the Belarus ambassador tomorrow morning to express our own concern at the political situation."
Ambassador Vladzimir Shchasny would see Foreign Office Permanent Under Secretary Sir John Coles on Friday morning.
Hopes for a compromise between Lukashenko and his parliamentary opponents dimmed on Thursday after the Belarussian leader snubbed a Russian peace initiative.
Lukashenko, who stayed away from talks with Russian parliamentary leaders on Wednesday, pressed ahead with his campaign for a referendum on Sunday to widen his powers.
